intro: Tetrasynandra laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered tetrasynandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, a feature typical of the carrot family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tetrasynandra laxiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and medicinal properties.
